results.headline: Review: ‘Prophet’s Prey,’ a Documentary About Mormon Fundamentalists
results.summary_short: Amy Berg’s film chronicles the rise and fall of Warren Jeffs, the leader of the Fundamentalist Church of Latter-day Saints.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Prophet's Prey

results.headline: Review: ‘Olvidados’ Revisits Rightist Terror in South America
results.summary_short: This Bolivian film depicts a retired general who is haunted by his past role in the torture and deaths of leftist activists.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Olvidados

results.headline: Review: ‘Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials’ Pits Hardy Teenagers Against a Mysterious Organization
results.summary_short: In the second installment in this film series, the heroes find themselves in a desolate landscape where humans have been ravaged by a deadly virus.

results.headline: Review: ‘Hellions’ Reminds Us That Halloween Isn’t About the Candy
results.summary_short: Demonic trick-or-treaters, spooky noises and a nod to “Rosemary’s Baby” create a fun, yet somewhat disappointing thriller.

results.headline: Review: ‘Everest’ Revisits a Fateful Adventure in 3-D
results.summary_short: Baltasar Kormakur’s film is a breathless, large-scale 3-D action spectacle about an ill-starred attempt to scale the planet’s highest peak.

results.headline: Review: ‘Cooties,’ Back to School With Zombies and Gore
results.summary_short: Tainted chicken nuggets in the cafeteria lead to a blood bath as teachers battle an undead uprising.

results.headline: Review: ‘Bonobos: Back to the Wild,’ a Sanctuary’s Rehab Mission
results.summary_short: This docudrama looks at the efforts of a conservationist named Claudine André, who runs a bonobo sanctuary in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Black Mass,’ Johnny Depp Is the Dead-Eyed Killer Whitey Bulger
results.summary_short: Scott Cooper’s film conjures a highly familiar gangster world of gamy characters, whackings and splattered brains.

results.headline: Review: ‘Tired Moonlight’ Quietly Paints a Picture of Small-Town Life
results.summary_short: A voice-over of the poet Paul Dickinson sporadically chimes in with verse, but images supply even finer poetry in this bleakly beautiful film.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Fool’ Is Yuri Bykov’s Look at Corruption
results.summary_short: In this film, Mr. Bykov’s main character is frustrated after noticing a structural flaw that could lead to a building’s collapse.

results.headline: Review: ‘Pawn Sacrifice,’ Another Take on the Royal Game
results.summary_short: Edward Zwick directs this film interpretation of the superpowers’ chess battle waged by Bobby Fischer and Boris Spassky in 1972.

results.headline: Review: ‘Peace Officer’ Explores Military-Style Raids by Law Enforcement
results.summary_short: Focusing on a quest by a retired sheriff, this documentary examines the consequences of the flow of military weapons to local departments.

results.headline: Review: In ‘The Perfect Guy,’ a Stalker Is Stirred
results.summary_short: Michael Ealy plays a computer-security analyst and Sanaa Lathan the object of desire he just can’t quit in this thriller directed by David M. Rosenthal.

results.headline: Review: Twin Terrors Haunt ‘Goodnight Mommy’
results.summary_short: When Mommy comes back from the hospital a changed person with bandages obscuring her face, her twins take action.

results.headline: Review: ‘Paul Taylor: Creative Domain’ Shows a Choreographer at Work

results.headline: Review: ‘The Visit’ Is ‘Hansel and Gretel’ With Less Candy and More Camcorders

results.headline: Review: ‘The Moving Creatures,’ Three Tales of Family Ordeals

results.headline: Review: ‘The Beauty Inside’ Features 123 Actors for One Leading Man

results.headline: Review: ‘Listening,’ a World Where Your Thoughts Are Not Your Own

results.headline: Review: In ‘Sleeping With Other People,’ Star-Crossed Sex Addicts Make a Pact
